Sv. sjufch rförvaikn. tj imanniaför^b., l-ed. av riks’d. anidra kamm. sed. 41. RVO.
translated: Hagård, Set Anders Alarik, a jurist and civil servant, member of parliament, born on January 2nd, 1888 in Habo, Skaraborg County, the first child of the lay judge Viktor Karlsson and Mathilda Pettersson. He married Alice Alilström in 1913 and they had one child, Börje, born in 1916. He then married Geraldine Blomgren in 1942 and had two more children, Birgit born in 1920 and Birger born in 1932. He completed his elementary school teaching course in 1908 and taught at Borås elementary school. He became the principal of Borås vocational school from 1920 to 1926, and then became a civil servant. He was a member of the city council (conservative) from 1931, a member of the municipal executive board from 1934, and was on the boards for social welfare and elementary education. He was vice-chair and chair of the board for the municipal girls' school and the theater board respectively. He was an executive member of the county relief committee in Älvborg County from 1917 to 1920, and the social inspector in the state unemployment agency from 1921 to 1924. He was a member of the board for the Swedish National Association of Disabled Veterans and served in the second chamber of the Riksdag from 1941. He was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa.

affiliation.name: Swedish National Association of Disabled Veterans
